p: Containing any outbreak of an airborne infectious disease involves implementing measures to limit face-to-face contact with the virus. This means that hospital staff and community members should wear surgical masks and take special precautions to maintain hand hygiene. It also means that they need to take particular precautions when removing gear (mask and gloves and medical equipment). Furthermore, effective containment of any viral outbreak includes the treatment of patients in isolation (wards), and (home) quarantine. 47 Before any of this can occur, however, the presence of, in this case, H5N1 or SARS has to be identified and response measures initiated.
